Thief: Skill Trained (Thievery)
Assurance (Religion): May forgo rolling a Religion check for an automatic 18
Automatic Knowledge (Religion): May use Assurance (Religion) to Recall Knowledge as a free action 1/rd
Cooperative Nature: +4 Aid checks
Dubious Knowledge: Failure on a Recall Knowledge check yields a mix of true and false information
Magical Shorthand: May learn new spells with 5 min of study per spell level; may retry 1 week after failure
Quick Identification: May use 3 actions to Identify Magic
Quick Recognition: May use a skill with master proficiency to Recognize a Spell as a free action 1/rd
Recognize Spell: (R) May gain guaranteed success in recognizing an unknown common spell of up to level 2/4/6/10 with trained/expert/master/legendary proficiency in the connected skill
Student Of The Canon: Critical failures on Religion checks to Decipher Writing or Recall Knowledge are normal failures/Failures to Recall Knowledge about own faith are successes, and successes are critical successes
Trick Magic Item: (1) A successful check on the related skill allows temporary activation of a magic item
Combat
Hit Points: 26 Armor Class: 18 (dexterity; trained) Class DC: Rogue: 18 (dexterity; trained)
Armor: None Shield: None
Combat Notes:
Constitution Hit Points Adjustment: +2
Dexterity Armor Class Adjustment: +4
Dexterity Attack Adjustment: +4
Strength Attack Adjustment: +1
Quick Draw: (1) May draw a weapon and Strike
Sneak Attack: +1d6 HP damage vs. flat-footed foe with agile, finesse, or ranged weapons
Surprise Attack: May use Deception or Stealth for initiative to inflict flat-footed on creatures that haven't acted
Thief: +3 HP damage with finesse melee weapons
Unbalancing Blow: Critical hits inflict flat-footed vs. self attacks until the end of next turn
Save: Fortitude: +5 (constitution; trained); Reflex: +10 (dexterity; expert); Will: +7 (wisdom; expert)
